Name: Sudha
Title: Can be avoided
Review: Very unhygienic surroundingsSurprise element was the alcohol offering to the deityThe socalled devotees were only speaking about the alcohol prasad

Name: S M
Title: Very good darshan
Review: Huge line, but managed a good darshan. üôèüôèTemple clean and neat.  Lots of monkeys around. There's a temple dedicated to Sri Dattatreya God, single face.

Name: pmmathur
Title: Very open spacious Temple
Review: Belief is that Kal Bhairav was the lords defence incharge and therefore kal bhairav should be also worshiped with the lord. Here wine/alcohol is offered as prasad to the lord. This temple is far from Mahakaleshwar temple.

Name: williamsamaddar
Title: Powerful place
Review: A trip to Ujjain is incomplete without offering a puja to Kaal Bhairav, the fearsome form of Lord Shiva who is believed to be the guardian deity of the city. Located a little over 5 kilometers to the north

Name: moloybora
Title: Best place to for Rahu Dosha elimination
Review: This is an unique temple in Tantrik Tradition and supplements Darshan of Maha Bhairav Temple  in Ujjain. The uniqueness is that the devotees offer liqueur in this Temple to the Shrine

Name: DrValliappan
Title: A rare temple of Kaala Bhairavar (Kal Bhairav) in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, Central India
Review: The vaahan (accompanying animal form; a statue of which faces the deity here is dog). There is also an unique tree of lamps just outside the temple. Small temple but, a lot of barricades make long, winding path for queues and combing the steps. Small shrine and on permission, photos / videos are allowed. If one goes through a shop keeper by buying archana items, short cuts to enter and exit temple are provided. No entry fee or charges. Kal Bhairav here is offered with bottles of liquor (as coconut, garland, banana, betel leaves etc are offered in many temples) and there are Pooja items shops with liquor shops outside. An unusual experience.

Name: dimpoo1971
Title: UNIQUE TEMPLE
Review: It is said that this must be visited to complete the Mahakaleshwar Darshan.The Prasad is Liquor, but it is not mandatory to offer it. Flowers can also be offered.First time in life I saw liquor being offered to God as Prasad in the temple.Temple is surrounded by shops selling liquor bottle along with flower, sweets etc.

Name: BharathiMani
Title: Unique
Review: A very unique and interesting temple. Kaal  Bhairav ji likes alcohol so that's offered to him. There are liquor shops outside.The temple entrance can be better maintained.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Unique Place where liquor offered to please God
Review: Shri Kal Bhairav temple is one of the famous and most visited temple of Ujjain situated close to Shipra river, which is located @ 6 km distance from Ujjain Mahakal Mandir.Ujjain Kal Bhairav temple is as much famous as Varanasi Kal Bhairav temple and there are some similarities between these two temple's formalities, one of that is visiting Kal Bhairav temple before visiting the Main Mahakal temple. It is believed that Kal Bhairav temple is located here since 6000 years and also details are mentioned in the Skanda Puranam. Present visible temple is built by King Bhadrasen in 9th century and then renovated during Maratha rulers, and there are suppose to be some good paintings in the Malwa style inside  but they are not visible today. Secondly no one has attention towards them as all eyes are on the deity, into whose mouth liquor is poured. This temple is Known for:1. This Kal Bhairav is regarded as the guardian of Avanthikapuram, which is called as Ujjain today. Due to this reason Ujjain Kal Bhairav lord is also called as Kotwal of the city.2. Liquor is offered here to Devotee as Prasad through out the year, witch is strange but true. The Priest offers Liquor in saucer and takes the saucer near the mouth of the Kal Bhairav idol, When he starts tilting the saucer, with in Minutes the wine will get empty and no one knows where it is going. Devotees believes that lord is having this Liquor.3. As per the standard rule Devotees first has to visit this temple and then only visit Mahakal Mandir. It is believed that without visiting Kal Bhairav temple, Ujjain trip will not fulfill and also if you are not visiting Kal Bhairav before Mahakal Mandir Visit, your wishes will not fulfill and will not get blessings of Mahakal. So most of the visitors first Visit's Kal Bhairav and then visits Mahakal Temple.Temple Timings:Morning 06:00 to Evening 08:00

Name: KeshavChakraborty
Title: Offering of liquor to God
Review: Very popular among pilgrims and tourists and also believed to be Live, that's why you will find much more crowd in this temple.

Name: SudarshanKS
Title: unique Kaalbhairav temple
Review: A nice temple dedicated to Lord Kalbhairav. The key offering to the Lord here is liquor sold in shops outside.Very nice kalbhairav moorthy and a blissful darshan

Name: abkush
Title: Nice temple
Review: We visited the temple during evening. It's a small temple with people offering liquor to Kal Bhairav ji.There is one huge deepmalika here, which is lighted in evening, we waited another 45 minutes for it to be lighted up, and it was very much worth the wait.The whole process of preparing deepmalika (towers of oil lamps) and lighting it up is quite unique and should not be missed.Darshan are quick and easy.

Name: windpace
Title: Check if the construction is over if travelling with elderly
Review: We visited the Kal Bhairav Temple in December 2021 along with my in-laws.  There is a lot of construction happening in front of the temple which meant my mother in law who has problems in walking had to take a round about (uneven) road to reach the temple.  So, if you are planning to visit with elderly or with divaang then you may want to check the status before making plans.  It is not that it is impossible to visit with them but it will likely be inconvenient.  Rest is all like what is said in other reviews.

Name: skdel2016
Title: Unbelievable but True
Review: Its an old temple complex . The main prashad is wine which is being offered to  Shri Kal Bhairav. The offered wine is drunk by Shri Kal Bhairav statue. Normally there is rush which can be managed better but administration is lacking here . In case of heavy rush Purohit put your offering of wine in container near Shri Kal Bhairav  which later being offered to Shri Kal Bhairav. It's unbelievable but true that statue drink the wine. There might be different science angle in this phenomenon but aastha and believes  are above all logics. Shi Kaal Bhairav is supposed to Senapati ( Head of Army) of Shri Mahkaal Raja.  Beware of Monkeys as well. Jai ho..

Name: AnshumanMaini
Title: Kal Bhairav
Review: Good place for a short visit. 5- 10 mins. We went during covid times and nowadays liquor is not being offered. So can't say much but one has to visit it after visiting Shri Mahakaaleshwar Jyotirling and that's about it. Jai Mahakaal!

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: A good temple to visit in ujjain
Review: Took an auto to this temple. Autos charge Rs 300 for visiting three places, Kal Bhairav mandir, Mangalnath temple & Sandipani ashram. We took an auto at about 6:00 Am so the charge was Rs 300 else the charge would have been Rs 350 as per the Auto driver.                We reached this temple at about 6:20 Am and this temple was completely free of other devotees. No shops which sell liquor/flowers were opened in this time.We had a good darshan of the lord.                Will suggest to visit this temple in early morning to beat heat of the day and also crowds.

Name: Ankush Sharma
Title: Nice Temple
Review: Very nice place and adorable. You can see lord drinking alcohol in front of you and people tried everything to find out the reason but failed. Must visit the temple. Avoid going on Sunday as you will be surprised to see long queues.

Name: Prasad Puranam
Title: good place
Review: Nice place by taxi / auto , it is there belief and faith in the GOD , It is about 20 minutes by auto for visit , if you hire a electric vehicle for Rs 300 for three hours drive

Name: Sktangriin
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: The place is well maintained and is thronged by people. The temple comprises statue of Kal Bhairav. The people offer liquor and other things to the deity. The temple is a must visit for people visiting Ujjain.

Name: Pramod1953
Title: very famous temple.
Review: we visited the temple on 10th Feb.'2020. it is one of the famous temple in Ujjain. The diety is Kal Bhairav.

Name: sangeeta68
Title: interesting place
Review: we had gone here after visiting the main temple of ujjain.here they worship god and give offering of spirits!

Name: Rudra Sharma
Title: Mahakaal and Kaal bhairav unique duo.......
Review: Ujjain is famous for its Jyotirlinga of Lord Shiva, i.e. Mahakaal; but it is equally famous for the temple of Kaal Bhairav. Situated in the outskirts of the city area, this temple is famous for its unique offering of liquor as prasadam for the deity. Visitors to this temple offer liquor besides usual offerings like coconut and flowers etc to the deity. The priest takes a small quantity of liquor in a plate and takes it near the lips of the deity. Within few seconds the liquor goes inside the mouth of the deity. Throughout the day this system continues and nobody knows as to where this liquor has gone. Obviously, for the followers, it is a miracle of the Lord; and one cannot deny it too as the miracle happens just in front of our eyes, so there is no doubt about rethinking or doubting.

Name: hipiyush007
Title: Old temple of Bhairo baba
Review: Its an old and ancint temple of Bharion baba. here devotee offer alcohal to Bhairon baba.Alcohal is easliy avaialble on all parshad shop outside temple but prices are on a bit higher side.Main temple entrance is very narrow so you need to wait for on hour in queue on normal days. Its also included in your mandir darshan package of auto.

Name: Sourav B
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple
Review: 1. Its towards the outside of the city, should cost around Rs 350 inclusive of 6 destination spots (inclusive of this one)2. Legend has it that you offer some sort of alcohol to the deity. You shall easily get it in the stalls outside.3. Though only a bit is allowed to pour in, the rest you can take away as offering prasad.

Name: Abhi62001
Title: Unique experience
Review: First time in my life I saw liquor being offered to God in the temple. Long queue for the dharshan. Beautiful entrance, surrounded by shops selling liquor bottle along wit flower and agarbathi. Cleanly maintained temple with lots of youngsters visiting the temple.

Name: Mili Dutta
Title: Divine
Review: Kal Bhairav temple is a must visit at Ujjain. Divinity at its best. Must visit incase you are Ujjain. Blessed!!The world famous Bhairav statue consuming alcohol can be witnessed here.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kal bhairav temple ujjain
Review: Most famous lord bhairav temple in ujjain.i visited on bhairav astami tithi.a lot of devotee there on bhairav astami.

Name: Debasish Das
Title: Wine god
Review: Once in my life ,I saw these god. Take wine as Prasad.there is long queue. So just visit the temple.

Name: Mohan
Title: Must visit to complete the Mahakaleswar Darshan
Review: 1. It is said that this must be visited to cmplete the Mahakaleshwar Darshan.2. The Prasad is Liquor, but it is not mandatory to offer it. Flowers can also be offered.3. Pooja in the anctum Santorum can be done by requesting the security staff .

Name: varadarajan
Title: Sri Kal Bhairav Temple - unique experience
Review: This temple is famous and unique - wine offering to God is primarily focussed. A clean, well maintained, spacious temple. A must visit temple in Ujjain. Enjoy and get blessed.

Name: Satya B
Title: Kal bhairav temple
Review: This is place of kaal bhairav where alcohol is offered as parshad. There seems to be no excise rules and regulations... Every prashad shop outside temple sells alcohol alonwith flowers and sweets.. If you visit Ujjain, this is a must visit place...

Name: Rohit Nanda
Title: Bhairo baba Temple
Review: I visited the place with family. The temple is big with a lot Monkeys. Wine shop is easily available opposite to the temple.To many beggars so ready for that.

Name: vinay760
Title: Ujjain Darshan
Review: this is one the very old and historic temple and must visit if visiting Ujjain,  This is also very crowded and suggest to go on working day.  please read history to understand importance and go with faith and do darshan. there is enough space out side for parking etc and can be managed better along with upkeep and cleanness for such historic temple.

Name: raj_Indb
Title: Nice Temple,
Review: This is nice temple, their are many wine shop near this temple, kal bherav is also take wine, I have go to many times in this temple

Name: Nithin M Agarwal
Title: A must visit for a better analysis on Hinduism.
Review: This temple is located near Ujjain and is worth visiting during your tour here. The temple is of Kaal Bhairava, an avataar of Lord Shiva. In Shaivism, he is a fierce manifestation of Shiva associated with annihilation.With faith and proper seeking of resolution, one gets peace of mind and courage do go through different situations in life. There is liquor being served as PRASADI to the Deity here. But, as HINDUISM says -- to connect with Him, you first need to be pure of heart. It is a re-built temple and holds the old MALWA type of architecture for one to visualize and understand.Date of Experience - March 2008.

Name: Sivakumar V
Title: An Ancient one with peculiar Prasadam
Review: This Kal Bairav Temple is dated back about 6000 years. The legend of this tmple centres arund Brhma  and Shiva. It is said that Brhma wanted to compose a fifth Veda in spite of Shiva not encouraging. Enraged Shiva sent a child Bhutak Bairav who pinched off Brahma,s fifth head. And to absolve of the sin of hurting Brahma, Shiva asked the Bairav to do penance on the banks of river Shipra. The hence the temple here for Bairav.This purnic episode is said to be in Skanda Purana.The peculiar and strange practice in this temple is that Bairav is offerd Wine as offereing and it is said that when the cup of wine is kept near the mouth of Bairav , the wine disappear! It is a - must see temple in Ujjain

Name: soumendra kumar M
Title: JAI KAL BHAIRAV
Review: A temple dedicated to the Kala Bairava - Yama (God of Death) an incarnation of Lord Shiva.One may offer wine to the Lord here. Lord however, takes very little and returns the maximum part to the devotee as His Prasad. Wine is sold at the gate of the temple. The priests are very cooperative.

Name: H. N. Pandey
Title: Kal Bhairav senapati of mahakal
Review: Kal Bhairav, A unique temple in india...Where you get wine as a prasada. can offer liquor as Prasad to Lord at any day in India. One can offer any brand of liquor which is available.Also there is unique part is , when liquor is pour , it is getting sucked and never leaked. There is discussion that even scientists have done the experiment to check where the liquor is going and not found the answer yet!

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Different practice
Review: In this temple apart from flowers, most of the devotees offer alcoholic drinks too. These are sold in most of the shops selling the flowers and located across the road from the temple.

Name: Jasraj pardeshi
Title: Mysterious Temple
Review: Once you reach the temple the most abstract thing will happen to you. The people there who sell flowers and haar  for the deity also sell you alcohol. Yes..! and that alcohol you have to offer it to the deity. When you enter the temple just give the bottle of alcohol to the guru there and watch. They offer it to the god in a plate like utensil and the deity literally sucks the alcohol in the plate and where does it go is an unsolved mystery.

Name: plpalani
Title: Temple dedicated to Lord Bhairav
Review: In this temple liquor  is taken as offering to the Lord.The temple is majestic with quite a few steps.

Name: Akhil Singal
Title: Kal Bhairav ka prasad hai Daaru (Alcohol)
Review: Great Place to visit. Travelled from Ujjain by cab and the 8kms run was just fantabulous. Surrounded by Shipra river and the mountains. When I reached,  it was drizzling which made the weather more enjoyable. I was surprised to see the  shops outside the temple were selling only alcohol  as it was the main offering to the God. I used my mobile camera to capture the precious moments. But the stay at this place is good enough for only an hour.Overall the visit was cool but the main thing which excited me was the offering to the God.

Name: Luv to Travel
Title: Jai Kaal Bhairva !!
Review: Had the opportunity to visit the temple on a Kalashtami day. Surprised to see what was offered to the deity.  Liquor was the main offering and it was really poured into the mouth of the deity and disappeared in a few seconds.  Blessed to be there.

Name: Binay Kumar P
Title: Pricing of offerings
Review: Always try to purchase the bottle of liquor for offering to the Kal vairab from the city, since the local vendors charge a heafty some, don't purchase from there and they ask for price more than the amount printed on it.

Name: Shael
Title: Alcohol offered by devotees
Review: Place is good and one of a kind where alcohols are offered by devotees. But this is not mandatory. Once offered you have to take it with you or you can give them to people waiting in temple premises. Do remember due to these offerings, an alcoholic smell will be in garbhagrih.

Name: Mitesh P
Title: Kal Bhairav - Unique place of Worship and faith
Review: Kal bhairav is unique place. At Kal Bhairav, devotee can offer liquor as Prasad to Lord at any day in India. One can offer any brand of liquor which is available.Also there is unique part is , when liquor is pour , it is getting sucked and never leaked. There is discussion that even scientists have done the experiment to check where the liquor is going and not found the answer yet !!!

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Unusual temple
Review: Shri Kaal Bhairav temple is at the outskirts of Ujjain about 6KM from Mahakaal temple. The temple is unique as liquor is offered here.

Name: Giri S
Title: Visit to kal bharav temple
Review: Different experience, not much rush. One can have peaceful and pleasant darshan. A must visit place in Ujjain.

Name: trivediar
Title: Amazing & Beautiful Place
Review: It is said that visit to Kal Bhairav Temple is necessary after visiting Shri Mahakaal Temple if you would like to accomplish your pilgrimage tour successful. Very nice and well managed temple.

Name: Sanjaykumar P V
Title: Unique temple
Review: A unique temple where whiskey bottles and any other form of liquor is offered as prasad.  Must visit just for the uniqueness

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: A unique temple in india...Where you get wine as a prasada.
Review: kal bhairav is one of the unique temple in india.  Lots of prasad shops outside the temple and liquor/wine is served to god as a prasad.  you can buy the wine bottles from outside shops and give it to pujari , he will put the wine on plate and touch this plate to the god's mouth and within a minute the wine disappeared from plate.. you can experience the live magic by visiting there.

Name: Gdj
Title: Kal bhairav temple
Review: One of the most famous temple in ujjain. Prasad of bhairav baba is wine.very crowded and attractive temple.

Name: Dipteshrao
Title: Good place to see
Review: It is a religious place to see once where Kal Bhairav used to drink liquor Nice place to see visit and experience

Name: rathod2017
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple
Review: Kal Bhairav Temple this is one of the famous temple in Ujjain. There is a Shivalinga in this temple which during Mahashivratri attracts thousands of visitors to this religious site. Kal Bhairav temple is said to be related with black Magic.

Name: ramnita16
Title: Non-rushed visit
Review: Visited on Friday evening about 8 PM. There was absolutely no crowd and was able to stand in front of God for sufficient time. Awesome feeling.

Name: Dipen Shah
Title: Must Visit once
Review: A must visit temple in india, where we offer wine to God.Worth watching process how they give wine as prasad to god.Amazing to watch it and blessed by darshanTry to avoid visit on sunday to avoid long que

Name: CHETANsurat
Title: JAY KAL BHAIRAV BABA
Review: Near Mahakal temple. Going in Auto.Auto fare is 140 to 170. Liquor is served to the Kal Bhairav BaBa and it is believed that Kal Bhairav BaBa consumes it. Liquor is sold in almost all shops in the premises.

Name: Yogesh L
Title: Very Serene
Review: A nice clean temple that has shivling almost 50 ft below the main entrance. In old time it must have been at river bank and now away by about 500 Mts. Must visit for Aarti that takes place at 4am.

Name: Leena N
Title: Kal bhairav Temple
Review: Its 15 minute away from mahakaleshwar temple. in rickshaw. approx rickshaw driver took 150/- rs per return journey  from mahakaleshwar temple. Temple is good. We visited during the holiday season so we got little rush, otherwise there is no rush you can easily take darshan in less than 10 minute.

Name: RanjithKumarPrabhu
Title: The devata who consumes liquor
Review: This is another famous temple at Ujjain. The temple is relatively smaller in area, and is located in the outskirts of the town. Liquor is served to the deity and it is believed that deity consumes it. Liquor is sold in almost all shops in the premises. There is also a pratishta of Dattatreya in the temple compound.

Name: Shankar I
Title: Senapati of Shiva
Review: The temple of Kala Bhairav is a must see, say the locals of Ujjain . They call him the senapati of Shiva and the head of Ashta Bhairavas. Liquor is the offering here.It is situated on the banks of the Kshipra river. One should watch your step while entering the shrine through the staircase. Some people's liquor bottle fall off their hands shattering the bottles and a threat to barefeeted devotees who follow.

Name: Neelamraju
Title: Interesting Offering - Liquor
Review: Ujjain City has a lot of Temples. The saying goes that if you carry a ton of rice and offer 4 grains to each temple, you will still run short of the grains..The Kal Bhairav temple is dedicated to Kal Bhairav, the guardian Deity  of Mahakal . It is located on the banks of the Shipra River. It is one of the most active temples in the city, visited by hundreds of devotees daily.Liquor is offered to the temple deity as one of the five tantric ritual offerings known as panchamakara  - Madya (alcohol), Maansa (meat), Meena or Matsya fish), Mudra (gesture or parched grain) and Maithuna (sexual intercourse). In older times, all five offerings were made to the deity, but now only alcohol is offered.We were amazed to see Indian as well as imported liquor was being offered. The priest takes the bottle from the devotee, opens it and pours some liquor in the saucer and keep near the lips of the deity and the liquor disappears. The remaining bottle is handed over to the devotee as Prasad..

Name: Sushant Kumar
Title: GOD who is fond of Alcohol
Review: Temple is unique in itself, where alcohol is served to idol and you can watch him drinking. You will find licensed wine shops outside temple premises. People offer variety of alcohol to GOD starting from Desi Daru to Scotch. Recommended visit to this temple if you are inn Ujjain specially if you want to see an idol drinking alcohol live.

Name: aalpaad
Title: Wonderful place
Review: It‚Äôs a powerful temple and it‚Äôs amazing to see how liquor is offered to Kaal Bhairav...a must visiting when ur visiting maha kaleshwar temple

Name: RAJIV1954
Title: Unique
Review: The temple is located around 10 kms from the city centre. The temple is unique in the sense that devotees offer hard liquor as the offering to the God Bhairav. There are lot Langgors in & around the temple.One should plan to go there only during the day because of it's far away location

Name: VivekPriyadarshi
Title: Whiskey offered to the Lord
Review: Yes.. The temple is around 8 kms from the Mahakaleshwar temple.. Autos ply from there regularly to Kal Bhairav temple.. Was amazed to see people carrying whiskey bottles in the Prasad basket as an offering.. Was told that the deity drinks the offered alcohol.. But you cannot see this.. People pour a few drops in a bowl kept in front and carry the rest home.. Must visit to see this unique thing..

Name: Vishnu Pendyala
Title: Does the presidiing diety really need hot liquor?
Review: Watched a number of devotees offering whiskey and what not to the Presiding Diety. Strange practice!

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: The guardian of ujjain
Review: He is the guardian of the ujjain city and the gadkalika mata, one of the shakti peedam in the city. the sayana aarati is from 830pm and is  so divine.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: Kaal bhairav ALCOHOLIC
Review: Had only heard about it, but for the first time seen here people carrying alcohol to the temple. Strange but true liquor bottles were sold outside shops and pandit ji in the temple was opening the bottles and offering it to the God...... Great

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Bhagwaan Drinks Whiskey
Review: visited this place on dry day on 26th Jan. didn't had a chance to see the magical event, this place is far from Mahakaal Temple if you don't have car then you can book auto from Temple.

Name: meenakshimuthusamy
Title: Well Divine
Review: The temple is very divine.The place is very nice to visit and good feel is felt on the inclusion of the temple in the tour.

Name: babita13
Title: Amazing
Review: The statue of deity is very attractive. Kal Bharaw is said to be Senapati of Lord Shiva. This is the place which is visited most commonly after Mahakal so there is rush but they manage it. the statue sucks alcohol and it is interesting factor.

Name: Shubham Karwa
Title: Know before you go
Review: Famous for its suspense regarding how bharu baba drink and its vanishes.Anyways take your hard drink as prasad from outside as shops in the premises doesnt keep all brands and keep just local vodka, etc that to with high margin !!So do take it from outside. !!Visit if u visit mahakal so that your wishes come true soon..

Name: Namjoshi
Title: Kal Bhairav Temple, Ujjain
Review: It is said that Kalbhairav was militory head of God Shankar. In temple you can see some paintings made during King Parmar fro Malawa. While chanting some mantras you can see he sucks the alcohol given for him near mouth.

Name: shaileshjpai
Title: Temple
Review: In this temple liquor is given to kalbhairav deity. You have to purchase a bottle  of liquor from liquor shops around the temple. They pour some in a saucer and pour in the mouth of the  deity.

Name: poojathakur13
Title: Must visit to see the unique prasad
Review: The uniqueness of this temple is the Prasad offered to the diety bhirava is alhohol. The temple is easy to go to and no longer queues.

Name: Vineet_Tuli
Title: Amazing !!!
Review: We visited Kaal Bhairav & it is one of the main temples of Ujjain. The aura of god is awesome & there is quite a rush in the morning thus plan accordingly.

Name: Yash
Title: A unique temple
Review: This is a unique temple of the God of Death. The deity is given alcohol as a prasad, and you can find liquor shops outside the temple. The rock, where the prasad is offered, absorbs the alcohol, and no other liquid. This is what makes the temple extremely unique in its own way

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Small but loving and powerful
Review: Very powerful but small and quiet.You could feel the presence of God.Did Aarti and was touched by the simple beauty within.

Name: Pree B
Title: Peaceful..
Review: We heard so much about this temple that it was a must see on our bucket list... it was the first time that we went to a hindu temple where alcohol was being offered...

Name: Atul Shah
Title: the diety that drinks wine
Review: a relatively clean hindu temple with daru as the offering and the prasad as well. a novelty to see and experience

Name: Ravi D
Title: Lord Kal Bhairav drinks liquor here
Review: Lord Kal Bhairav is offered liquor, which is put in a plate, put at the lord's lips and liquor vanishes somewhere (supposedly Kal bhairav drinks the same).If you want to offer liquor, it is available (both country made and English) in the market surrounding the temple. Worth a visit

Name: Dilip123
Title: Deity who drinks liquor!
Review: The ancient temple of kaal bhairav is a must visit in Ujjain. There are shops outside the temple that sell offerings that include liquor. We did not buy any of those offerings but witnessed the miracle of the deity drinking liquor.Liquor is poured into a silver saucer and  then poured into the open mouth of the idol. The remaining liquor in the saucer is retained in a silver pot in front of the idol and half the unused liquor in the bottle is returned to the devotees as prasad!

Name: meghashyam
Title: Kaal bhairav
Review: One of three kaal temples other two being Mahakaleshwar and Gadkalika maa temple . Kaal bhairav emanates power n protection . Lord is swamboo .

Name: Payal G
Title: Foreign liquor = Wishes on fast track
Review: A unique temple in Ujjain where alcohol is the primary offering made to the diety. Kal Bhairav is considered to be the Senapati (Commander-in-Chief) or the guardian deity of Ujjain. It is an important shaivaite temple where thousands come to pray daily. The local shops surrounding the main entrance sell a variety of alcohol which is the primary offering (they claim that offering foreign brands makes the Lord fulfill wishes faster). A jatra or festival day while crowded is very colorful (crowd can get unruly). One has to be wary of pickpockets in the crowd.

Name: ANAND V
Title: Baba Saheb ki Jai
Review: Kal Bhairav also known as Senapati of lord Shiva. This is one of the very ancient temple of Ujjain. Its believed and also can be observed that Baba saheb (Lord Kal Bhairav) himself have the alcohol in this temple. You will definitely feel relaxed and one can feel a mental peace in temple campus.

Name: Sunnilbgautam
Title: Guardian of Ujjain
Review: I visited it around 9am Aarti. In spite of the loud music played, it was sirene & peaceful. Could feel a strong presence at the Alter. It was wonderful. There is also a Dutta Temple here. The backyard garden has a few monkeys (Langoors) swinging up the tree branches. It was quite a watch for my Son.

Name: Mahesh Kulkarni
Title: Tirth of Alcohol to Lord Shiva at Kalbhairav Temple Ujjain
Review: Offer in of Alcohol to the Lord Shiva is the differentiator of this temple from other Shiva Temple.Devotees bring alcohol and the  Statue of Lord Shiva is fed with this unique offer ing and it goes down inside mouth if the statue.A must visit Shiva Temple at Ujjain.

Name: Arvind S
Title: Lord Shiva's bodyguard temple
Review: Kal Bhairava is as per Indian mythology known as guard to lord Shiva. This temple is situated bit far from main mahakal temple,on the bank of holy river.Devotees used to offer liquor as prasadam. Not much fascinating tourist spot but holy place for Hindus..means a lot..So visit to feel serenity and positive spritual vibes.Must visit along with Mahakal.

Name: Swarg tours & travels
Title: Best & surprising Kalbhairav
Review: This Temple is approximately 4 kilo meter from main Temple. Kalbhairav is a body guard of Shivji. Kalbhairav takes only wine. Opposite side so many wine Shop here  A surprising things, Still nobody can find where wine is going after giving him too much wine everyday. Don't Miss this place.

Name: rohit s
Title: Mahakaal visit
Review: Positive devotional place in ujjain. Kaalbhairav is the senapati of Mahakaal.. Very nicely managed devasthan

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Unique temple where liquor is offered to god
Review: This temple is dedicated to god Kalabhairava who is told as senapati of Lord Mahakaleahwar. Here liquor is offered to god and when the poojari keeps the plate with liquor near the slit of mouth of the idol, the liquor disappears. Outside the temple there are state government authorised liquor shops. Small gudis dedicated to other gods are inside the temple. It is a custom to visit this temple before visiting Mahakaleahwar Jyotirlinga.

Name: anubhavmpm
Title: Blessings of God
Review: This is a temple where everyone offers alcohol to God Kaal Bhairav. The temple is well kept and maintained and the rituals are soothing.

Name: Omkar P
Title: VISIT TO KAL BHAIRAV TEMPLE
Review: The temple is very old but there are lot of devotee and here the peoples are giving wine as a Prasada to God Kal Bhaiav. Arrangement is not so bad.

Name: arunbvkumar
Title: God being offered Liquor.
Review: Lord Kaala Bhairav is offered Liquor and the mystery is the idol sips some. it is one of the unique places in our mythology and a must place to visit. Hair Raising experience.

Name: Vacation815975
Title: Jai Kaam Bhairav
Review: This palace is very mysterious, kaal bhairav temple is very ancient temple, lord kaal bhairav consume liquor as offering from devotees. Very very special palace.

Name: rameshtiwari03
Title: Darshan
Review: We have visited many times to Ujjain and went to Kal Bhairav Temple for Darshan. Their apart from other Prasad Liquor is also one item normally serve to God.

Name: The Golden Age f
Title: Mystery God
Review: The mystery of this temple is Alcohol is offered to God and the complete  alcohol  disappears from the plate when offered. Outside the temple small bottles of alcohol are available. As it was saawan month lot of rush in the temple. Another surprising act I found was people throw flowers at diya stand if it gets stuck to it they say there wishes will be fulfilled.    Outside the temple is beautiful you can see Kshipra river from top. Overall a very nice temple can't be missed if you are in Ujjain.

Name: piyushkachchhava
Title: one of the best temple to visit in ujjain
Review: in june,we almost visited more than 10 places.where thousands of temples are present.and in all of them kaal bhairav temple is too peaceful where whiskey is the prasad.and the brahmins who do all the care of temple like pooja,aarti and bhajan.a very peaceful environment around this temple,at that temple there is one holy pillar where people throw a flowers and if sticks that means your wish will be fufill.

Name: Viral Arya
Title: Jai Kal Bhairav
Review: This is a Hindu Temple, located around 5kms from Mahakal Jyotirlinga and a must visit to complete darshan of Mahakal. This temple is dedicated to Kal Bhairav, the guardian god of the city. The strangest thing of this temple is that Liquor offering to Kaal Bahirav during worship
